prompt: <description>**Part 1: A Long, Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** **Step 1: Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to -90.0, 0.0, and -90.0 degrees, and set the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will define the orientation and position of the 2D sketch plane. **Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch** Create the first face of the 2D sketch. This face will contain two loops, each made up of four lines. For loop 1, draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.0434, 0.0]. Then, draw a line from point [0.0434, 0.0] to point [0.0434, 0.0434]. Next, draw a line from point [0.0434, 0.0434] to point [0.0, 0.0434]. Finally, draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0434] back to point [0.0, 0.0]. This will create a closed loop. For loop 2, draw a line from point [0.0026, 0.0026] to point [0.0408, 0.0026]. Then, draw a line from point [0.0408, 0.0026] to point [0.0408, 0.0408]. Next, draw a line from point [0.0408, 0.0408] to point [0.0026, 0.0408]. Finally, draw a line from point [0.0026, 0.0408] back to point [0.0026, 0.0026]. This will create a second closed loop. **Step 3: Scale the 2D Sketch** Apply a scaling transformation to the 2D sketch. The scaling parameter is 0.0434. **Step 4: Transform the 2D Sketch into a 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **Step 5: Extrude the 2D Sketch to Create the 3D Model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.75 units. Do not extrude in the opposite direction. This will create the 3D model of the part. The final dimensions of the part are as follows: - Width: 0.0434 units - Length: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0434 units</description>
